Description: One artefact and 5 beads in different shapes and materials. A: Conical artefact made of red carnelian, with a flat base and a pointed top, broken off at the end, possibly when the perforation was started. Well finished. The thinner end has several flattened areas from the rough shaping. Possibly a gaming-figure. B: Spacer-bead made of light turquoise faience, two and a half segments preserved, good quality. C: Small remains of a cylindrical segmented bead with a very small diameter. Two segments preserved. D: Very short cylindrical bead made of a light blue faience. E: Elongated spherical bead made of faience with faint traces of a light blue glaze. F: Disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
